Login as : Please fill the data Password didn\'t match english Lesson Card cards Kanji Kanji Test Grammar Daily Talk JLPT Test Hiragana Chart Katakana Chart Japan Info Japanese course in Indonesia References About Developer Inocen (Inovasi Cendekia Bangsa) see Inovasi Cendekia Bangsa website About Sponsor STRENGTH see Naoyuki website 1. From Indonesia to Indonesia. 2. Have representatives office in Indonesia and Japan 3. Founded by alumni and professionals who have long lived in Japan (more than 14 years living in Japan) 4. Having international cooperation (in collaboration with companies in Japan and supported by Indonesian students abroad) Inovasi Cendekia Bangsa or abbreviated as Inocen is startup with a social mission to help collaboration between Indonesia and Japan. And one way to help this collaboration is to improve Japanese language skills for Indonesians both in quality and quantity. Go Jepang© is made to help friends in learning Japanese. With this Go Japan application for learning Japanese will be easier, cheaper and more fun. Chapter 1 Chapter 2 Chapter 3 Chapter 4 Chapter 5 Chapter 6 Chapter 7 Chapter 8 Chapter 9 Chapter 10 Introduction Object Places Time Adverb Verb Intro Verb Adjective Hobbies Greetings Which one do you prefer? Learning by: Alphabet Kana Kanji In this chapter, you will learn these words: Lets start! NEW CARD! Kanji Level 1 Level 2 Level 3 Level 4 Level 5 Level 6 Level 7 Level 8 Level 9 Level 10 Level 11 Level 12 Level 13 Level 14 Level 15 Level 16 Level 17 Level 18 Level 19 Level 20 Level 21 Level 22 Level 23 Level 24 Level 25 Level 26 Level 27 Level 28 Level 29 Level 30 Level 31 Level 32 Level 33 Level 34 Level 35 Level 36 //kanji test menu Kanji Test Level 1-10 Level 11-20 Level 21-30 Level 31-40 Level 41-50 //grammar pattern 1 Grammar Sample sentences: Pattern 1 N + は + N + です N + Wa + N + Desu The particle は follows the topic the speaker wants to talk about. Therefore, は is often called topic marking particle. The particle は follows the topic the speaker wants to talk about. Therefore, は is often called topic marking particle. Note : the particle は is read わ. Note : the particle ha is read wa. 1. 私は田中です。 1. わたしはやまだです。 1. watashi wa yamada desu I am Tanaka. 2. 私は学生です。 2. わたしはがくせいです。 2. watashi wa gakusei desu I am a student. //grammar pattern 2 Pattern 2 N + は + N + じゃ ありません N + Wa + N + Ja Arimasen じゃありません is the negative form of です. Ja arimasen is the negative form of desu. 1. 私は山下じゃありません。 1. わたしはやましたじゃありません 1, Watashi wa yamashita ja arimasen I am NOT Yamashita. 2. 私は学生じゃありません。 2. Watashi wa gakusei ja arimasen 2. わたしはがくせいじゃありません。 I am NOT a student. //grammar pattern 3 Pattern 3 sentence + か sentence + ka The particle か has many functions. The particle ka has many functions. 1. Final interrogative particle, similar to a question mark "?" 2. particle marking alternatives in a list; "or" 3. whether (or not) お元気ですか。 おげんきですか Ogenki desuka How are you? オレンジか、リンゴか。 オレンジか、リンゴか。 Orenjika, ringoka. orange or apple? 行くか知らない。 いくかわからない。 Ikuka wakaranai I do not know whether he will go. //grammar pattern 3 part 2 Pattern 3 (part 2) 4. Indication of doubt 行くかと思いますが。 いくかとおもいますが Ikuka to omoimasuga I think he will go (but I am not sure). //grammar pattern 4 Pattern 4 N + も N + Mo Particle も is added after a topic instead of は when the statement about the topic is the same as the previous topic; similar to "also". Particle mo is added after a topic instead of wa when the statement about the topic is the same as the previous topic; similar to "also". 田中さんは学生です。 たなかさんはがくせいです Tanaka-san wa gakusei desu Mr. Tanaka is a student. 山下さんも学生です。 やましたさんもがくせいです Yamashita-san mo gakusei desu Mr. Yamashita is also a student. //grammar pattern 5 Pattern 5 N + の + N N + No + N Particle の is used to connect two noun. Particle no is used to connect two noun. 田中さんはサクラ大学の学生です。 たなかさんはサクラだいがくのがくせいです Tanaka-san wa sakura daigaku no gakusei desu Mr. Tanaka is a Sakura University student. これは私の本です。 これはわたしのほんです Kore wa watashino hon desu This is my book.
WELL DONE! Too Bad Your Score is: Now you can continue to chapter Your score must above 70 to continue learning in chapter You have finished the chapter You do not pass the chapter Thanks to our sponsor! Naoyuki Academic Center Naoyuki Academic Center was first introduced in October 2017 by the founders who are alumni of Japanese Universities and professionals who have lived in Japan for a long time. After getting extraordinary experience from Japan, the founders wanted to help other friends to go to Japan. The founders tried to solve the obstacles faced by students to go to Japan, such as: lack of information obtained by students in Indonesia, lack of confidence in students to Japan, and lack of foreign language skills, especially Japanese.
ADDRESS Jl.Veteran 10-11, Gd Inbis Lt 4, Univ Brawijaya, Malang. Aichi ken, Nishio shi, Yonezu cho, Kitaura 75-1, Japan Malang Yogyakarta Bandung Surabaya / Sidoarjo Other cities Will be updates in the next features Naoyuki Academic Center Japanese Café (JEC) Easy Japanese Easy Japanese - Private +62811 36969 97 +6281 3567 8358 +62811 3777 540 +62858 7925 1994 +62858 7925 1994 Jl. Veteran no 10-11, Gedung Inbis Lt 4, Universitas Brawijaya, Malang. Jl. Jakarta no 20, Mom milks café. Jl. Ring Road Selatan, no 66. Gamping Kidul, Sleman. Griya Cempaka Arum Blok D3 no 3, Rancanumpang, Gedebage, Bandung. Perumahan Delta Mandala 1 no 12, Semambung, Gedangan, Sidoarjo. RECOMMENDATION PLACES To Learn Japanese in Indonesia Therefore the founders formed a forum called Naoyuki Academic Center. Naoyuki is taken from Japanese which has the implicit meaning of "honesty and happiness" in the hope of being able to realize the dream of Indonesian students to Japan, either through study, internship, study tour, or work as a professional. 1. English Course 2. Internship in Japan 3. Study to Japan 4. Study Tour 5. Travelling in Japan 6. Education Seminar make this education free see more about University
